intro: Ceropegia santapaui, commonly known as the Santapaui milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia santapaui is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
